meanings.definition: An organism consisting of a cell or cells in which the genetic material is DNA in the form of chromosomes contained within a distinct nucleus.
meanings.sent1: Eucaryotes are living things with a special part that holds their DNA.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study eucaryotes to learn more about cells and genetics.
meanings.sent3: The eucaryotes in the pond were having a party in their tiny nucleus.
meanings.sent4: In the world of cells, eucaryotes are like kings with their own castles.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, eucaryotes look like tiny worlds with their nucleus as the center.

meanings.definition: A member of the domain Eukaryota, which includes all organisms except bacteria, archaea, and viruses.
meanings.sent1: Eucaryotes are part of a big group that doesn't include bacteria or viruses.
meanings.sent2: In the tree of life, eucaryotes have their own branch separate from bacteria.
meanings.sent3: At the biology conference, the eucaryotes were the popular kids who didn't hang out with bacteria.
meanings.sent4: In the ecosystem, eucaryotes are like the cool kids who don't mingle with the viruses.
meanings.sent5: The world of eucaryotes is vast and diverse, unlike the simple world of bacteria and viruses.
